item.title: Question mark over Rohit’s place in side: Gambhir says decision to be made “after a look at pitch” - The Indian Express
item.description:
Questions Surround Rohit Sharma's Place in Indian Cricket Team Ahead of Final Test

Publication Date: Not mentioned
Source: Indian Express

Speculations surrounding the future of Indian captain Rohit Sharma have increased as the team prepares for the final Border-Gavaskar Trophy Test at Sydney. Coach Gautam Gambhir indicated that a decision on Rohit's inclusion will depend on the pitch conditions.

  • Rohit's current average in the series stands at 6.20.
  • Gambhir states that the decision will be made after assessing the pitch.
  • Concerns over Rohit's poor form and multiple dismissals have led to questions about his place in the team.
  • Rohit's scoring sequence since September has been less than impressive, with low scores in recent matches.
  • India has a chance to draw the series 2-2, making Rohit's form even more critical.
“We shall look at the pitch and take a call tomorrow.” - Gautam Gambhir

The situation presents a pivotal moment for Rohit Sharma, with the team's chances in the series resting on the decision of the management regarding his selection.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir refuses to confirm Rohit Sharma in India XI for Sydney Test: ‘Head coach is here, that should be enough’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir said that India will announce their playing eleven after assessing the conditions and refused to state whether captain Rohit Sharma will be in it

Date: Jan 02, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

India's head coach Gautam Gambhir has not confirmed the inclusion of captain Rohit Sharma in the playing eleven for the upcoming Test match against Australia in Sydney. As Australia leads the series 2-1, there are speculations surrounding the team's performance and Rohit's form.

  • Australia leads the Test series 2-1 against India.
  • The last Test was under the captaincy of Jasprit Bumrah, where India achieved a win.
  • Rohit Sharma has struggled with form, averaging just 10.93 in 15 innings this season.
  • Gambhir assures that everything is fine with Rohit and that the decision relies heavily on assessing the conditions.
“Everything is fine with Rohit and I don't think it's anything traditional. The head coach is here and that should be good enough.” - Gautam Gambhir

Gambhir emphasized the need for final evaluations on the wicket before finalizing the team, indicating that the decision regarding Rohit's placement remains open for now.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir Breaks Silence On Dressing Room Leaks, Blasts 'Natural Game' Excuse - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir Breaks Silence On Dressing Room Leaks Ahead Of Sydney Test

Publication Date: December 24, 2024   Source: NDTV

Gautam Gambhir, the head coach of India, comments on the need for dressing room discussions to remain private, amidst reports of unrest. He emphasizes performance as the key to maintaining team integrity.

  • Gambhir stated that debates in the dressing room should remain confidential and described recent reports as false.
  • He affirmed, "Indian cricket will be in safe hands till honest people stay in the dressing room."
  • Gambhir announced that Akash Deep will miss the upcoming New Year Test due to injury.
  • India prepares for the final Test against Australia, with the series currently at 2-1 in favor of Australia.
"Debates between coach and player should remain in dressing room. Stern words. They were just reports not truth."

In conclusion, Gambhir's remarks aim to reassure fans regarding team dynamics ahead of a crucial match against Australia.

item.title: IND vs AUS: Akash Deep Set To Miss Sydney Test Due To Back Issue, Gautam Gambhir Confirms - News18
item.description:
Akash Deep to Miss Sydney Test Against Australia Due to Injury

Last Updated: January 02, 2025, 14:08 IST | Source: News18

Indian pacer Akash Deep is set to miss the fifth Test against Australia due to a back issue as confirmed by Head Coach Gautam Gambhir during a press conference.

  • Akash Deep has been struggling with a stiff back ahead of the Border-Gavaskar series finale in Sydney.
  • He participated in the previous two Tests in Brisbane and Melbourne but only managed two wickets.
  • The Indian team's fielding standards have been criticized for dropping several catches off his bowling.
  • His high workload of 87.5 overs may have contributed to the injury.
  • Potential replacements include Harshit Rana and Prasidh Krishna.
Gautam Gambhir stated, "The 28-year-old pacer is set to miss the Sydney Test due to a back issue."

The Indian team's success in the Sydney Test is crucial for their chances to qualify for the World Test Championship final.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir Delivers Bad News, Star Pacer Ruled Out Of Sydney Test vs Australia - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Akash Deep Ruled Out of Sydney Test Against Australia Due to Injury

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: NDTV

India pacer Akash Deep has been ruled out of the fifth and final Test against Australia due to a stiff back. He took five wickets in two matches, but dropped catches limited his potential. Coach Gautam Gambhir confirmed his absence, noting that a replacement will be decided after pitch assessment.

  • Akash Deep cannot play due to back issues.
  • He bowled 87.5 overs across two matches, contributing five wickets.
  • India must win the final Test to retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Australia's Mitchell Marsh has been dropped due to poor performance.
  • Beau Webster will debut in place of Marsh as confirmed by captain Pat Cummins.
  • Australia aims to clinch the Border-Gavaskar Trophy for the first time since 2014/15.
“Mitch knows that he hasn't scored enough runs,” said Cummins regarding Marsh's exclusion.

This injury marks a setback for India as they aim to level the series with a must-win match in Sydney.

item.title: 'Ashwin's mid-series retirement selfish. He won't make it public but it was a spiteful reaction…': Daryll Cullinan to HT - Hindustan Times
item.description:
'Ashwin's mid-series retirement selfish. He won't make it public but it was a spiteful reaction…': Daryll Cullinan to HT

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Hindustan Times

The Border-Gavaskar Trophy is nearing its end with Australia leading 2-1 against India. As the teams prepare for the Sydney Test, former South African cricketer Daryll Cullinan criticizes Ravichandran Ashwin's decision to retire mid-series, calling it selfish and disruptive.

  • India's senior players, including Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, are underperforming.
  • Cullinan suggests Rohit Sharma should transition to white-ball cricket due to his struggles with pace bowling.
  • Virat Kohli's technical flaws are outlined as contributing to his lack of form.
  • Cullinan shares concerns about Rishabh Pant's approach to batting in critical situations.
  • He expresses doubts about fast bowlers being made Test captains, hinting at Jasprit Bumrah's potential leadership.
  • Cullinan believes that India has the potential to win the Sydney Test but criticizes Ashwin's mid-series retirement as a detrimental decision.
“Ashwin should not be retiring or allowed to retire mid-series. It was a selfish move, clearly for reasons he won't make public.” - Daryll Cullinan

Cullinan concludes that the South African team qualifying for the World Test Championship final is a significant achievement, but questions the seriousness of the Championship's format.

item.title: Australia drop Mitchell Marsh for final Test against India, replacement announced - Crictoday
item.description:
Australia Drops Mitchell Marsh for Final Test Against India

Date: SYDNEY (AP)

The Australian cricket team has announced changes ahead of the final test match against India, dropping allrounder Mitchell Marsh in favor of debutant Beau Webster. The match is crucial for Australia to regain the Border-Gavaskar trophy and secure a spot in the upcoming World Test Championship final.

  • Australia needs to win or draw the match to regain the Border-Gavaskar trophy.
  • Mitchell Marsh has been struggling, playing only 13 overs in the last three tests without taking a wicket.
  • Beau Webster, who has performed well in first-class cricket, gets his debut.
  • Mitchell Starc has been cleared to play despite rib soreness.
  • India could retain the trophy with a win, marking a record fifth consecutive time.
“Mitchy obviously hasn’t quite got the runs and perhaps wickets this series.” - Pat Cummins

This significant match at the Sydney Cricket Ground represents both a challenge and an opportunity for the Australian team as they aim to end the series on a high note.

item.title: Australia Drop This Star From Playing XI For Series-Deciding Test vs India. Debut Confirmed - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Australia Drop Mitch Marsh, Confirm Beau Webster's Debut for Series-Deciding Test vs India

Date: December 28, 2023
Source: NDTV

Out-of-form all-rounder Mitch Marsh was axed from Australia's team for the series-deciding fifth Test against India in Sydney with Beau Webster set to make his debut. Fast bowler Mitchell Starc retained his place despite a rib niggle.

  • Mitch Marsh dropped after poor series
  • Beau Webster to debut
  • Mitchell Starc retains place despite injury
"Mitchy obviously hasn't quite got the runs or wickets he would have liked this series and felt like it was time for a freshen up," said skipper Pat Cummins.

Australia are 2-1 up and will regain the Border-Gavaskar trophy if they win or draw the Test.

item.title: Rain Threat Looms Over Sydney Test? Report Has Some Bad News For India - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rain Threat Looms Over Sydney Test? Report Has Some Bad News For India

Publication Date: December 31, 2024

Source: NDTV

The fifth and final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Sydney faces potential rain disruption during its concluding days, raising concerns for the Indian cricket team.

  • The New Year's Test starts on January 3 at the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG).
  • Rain is anticipated on the last two days, with a 25% chance of rain on day one, reducing to 5% on day two.
  • Day four and five may experience inclement weather with showers and heavy rain expected.
  • India trails the series 2-1, needing to win to retain the trophy and keep alive their World Test Championship hopes.
  • Australia is dealing with injury issues, including missing pacer Josh Hazlewood.
“India have failed to make a big impact in the series and are trailing by 1-2.”

The looming rain threatens not only the match outcome but also India's ability to turn around their performance in the series.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Rishabh Pant to be axed from India XI as Rohit Sharma, Gautam Gambhir plan strict action; Akash Deep out of Sydney Test - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rishabh Pant Likely to Be Dropped from India XI for Sydney Test

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

India is expected to make changes to their playing XI as they aim to save the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series in the upcoming match against Australia at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Rishabh Pant's poor performance may lead to his exclusion from the team.

  • Akash Deep is likely out of the Sydney Test due to a back injury.
  • Rishabh Pant has faced criticism for his recent batting displays, scoring only 154 runs in seven innings at an average of 22.
  • The team may rely on Dhruv Jurel if Pant is benched, who has had limited game time in this series.
  • Gautam Gambhir and Rohit Sharma are deliberating over team changes to improve performance.
“Stupid, stupid, stupid,” commented Sunil Gavaskar on Pant's dismissals at the MCG, highlighting the pressure on the young player.

The decision to change the lineup reflects India's struggles in the current Test series and may impact their approach to future games as they seek to regain momentum.

item.title: NZ bowl in cloudy Nelson; Wickramasinghe, Rajapaksa in for Sri Lanka - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
New Zealand Opts to Bowl First in Final T20I Against Sri Lanka

Date & Source: March 12, 2023, from ESPNcricinfo

Introduction: New Zealand has won the toss and elected to bowl first against Sri Lanka in the final T20I match in Nelson. The hosts aim to secure a 3-0 series sweep.

  1. Unchanged XI for New Zealand: The hosts have decided to stick with the same playing XI that won the first two games.
  2. Sri Lanka's Changes: Bhanuka Rajapaksa and Chamidu Wickramasinghe are in, replacing Kamindu Mendis and Matheesha Pathirana.
  3. Pitch and Conditions: The overcast start might assist the seamers, but the wicket looks good for batting.

Conclusion: New Zealand looks to maintain their winning momentum, while Sri Lanka seeks to avoid a series whitewash.

item.title: NZ bowl in cloudy Nelson; Wickramasinghe, Rakapaksa in for Sri Lanka - ESPNcricinfo
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: IND vs AUS: Australia make big change in playing XI for Sydney Test against India - The Times of India
item.description:
Australia Revamps Squad for Sydney Test Against India

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Times of India

Australia's captain Pat Cummins has announced a significant change in the playing XI for the fifth and final Test against India, with Beau Webster making his Test debut.

  • Beau Webster will replace Mitch Marsh in the squad due to Marsh's poor form.
  • Webster is set to become Australia's 469th men’s Test player.
  • Australia leads the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series 2-1 heading into the final match.
  • Mitchell Starc has been cleared to play despite a rib niggle.
“He was never going to miss this one,” said Cummins about Starc's commitment.

This change aims to enhance Australia's batting strength while facing a competitive Indian side at the SCG.

item.title: Barcelona Turn to £52M-Rated Chelsea Ace for Dani Olmo Solution Amid PSG Links - PSG Talk
item.description:
Barcelona Eyes Chelsea's Christopher Nkunku as Olmo Backup

Publication Date: Not specified Source: PSG Talk

Barcelona is considering a loan move for Christopher Nkunku from Chelsea as a potential solution if they cannot register Dani Olmo this winter.

  • Nkunku joined Chelsea in 2023 for £52 million but has struggled to secure a starting spot.
  • Top clubs like Manchester United and PSG are monitoring Nkunku’s situation.
  • Barcelona may look into a loan deal for Nkunku, potentially covering part of his salary.
  • The timeline of offloading current players could dictate Barcelona's pursuit of Nkunku.
“If the process of offloading players takes too long, the club could explore a loan move for Christopher Nkunku.”

Barcelona's strategy may shift based on their ability to register Olmo and manage their wage structure effectively.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah Breaks R Ashwin's All-Time Rating Points Record In ICC Rankings - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Breaks R Ashwin's All-Time Rating Points Record In ICC Rankings

Last Updated: January 01, 2025, 20:15 IST, Source: News18

Fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah continues to reach new heights. On Wednesday, Bumrah surpassed India legend Ravichandran Ashwin’s all-time rating-point record in ICC rankings. Ashwin held the record for eight years when he reached rating of 904 in December 2016 which was the highest ever for an Indian bowler. In the latest rankings, Bumrah has 907 rankings points which is a new record for an Indian.

It is also the joint-17th highest in the all-time list with Derek Underwood of England.

  • Bumrah's achievement of 907 rating points surpasses Ashwin's previous record of 904.
  • This marks Bumrah as the world's top-ranked Test bowler.
  • He took 9 wickets in the latest match in Melbourne, bringing his series total to 30 over four matches.
“Despite India suffering a big defeat at the hands of Australia, Bumrah's performance has been stellar.”

The achievement is significant as it reflects Bumrah's dominance and sets a new benchmark for Indian bowlers.

item.title: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli welcome 2025 in style: Spotted celebrating New Year in Sydney - WATCH - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli Welcome 2025 in Style

Published on January 1, 2025 - Source: Times of India

Bollywood actress Anushka Sharma and Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli were spotted celebrating the New Year in Sydney. The couple was seen enjoying the fireworks display at the Sydney Harbour. They were joined by a few friends and seemed to be having a great time.

  • The couple was seen enjoying the fireworks display at the Sydney Harbour.
  • They were joined by a few friends for the celebrations.
  • This is the first time the couple has been spotted together since the birth of their daughter in January 2022.
"It's always great to start the new year with the love of your life," said Anushka Sharma when asked about their New Year plans.

The couple was last seen together at a charity event in Mumbai in December 2024. They have been quite private about their personal lives since the birth of their daughter.

item.title: Mulder: 'I'm here to win games for my country, I'm not here to fill a spot' - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Mulder: 'I'm here to win games for my country, I'm not here to fill a spot'

Publication Date: N/A Source: ESPNcricinfo

Wiaan Mulder expressed his frustration at not being able to play due to injury but is determined to make a significant contribution upon his return to the South African cricket team.

After four weeks on the sidelines with a broken finger, Mulder is now fit to play in the upcoming Test against Pakistan. He has shown significant improvement in his batting and bowling performances and is eager to prove himself.

  • Wiaan Mulder was sidelined due to a broken finger sustained during a match against Sri Lanka.
  • He returned to the team after rigorous rehab and expressed his desire to contribute to victories.
  • Mulder's recent performances include a half-century and a century in Test cricket.
  • He emphasizes the importance of teamwork and resilience in high-pressure moments.

"I'm here to win a game for my country. I'm not just here to fill a spot... we never give up. We're always fighting." - Wiaan Mulder

Mulder aims to solidify his spot in the team by demonstrating his capabilities in the upcoming matches against Pakistan.

item.title: SA vs PAK - Wiaan Mulder - 'I'm here to win a game for my country. I'm not here to fill a spot' - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Mulder: 'I'm here to win games for my country, I'm not here to fill a spot'

Publication Date: N/A Source: ESPNcricinfo

Wiaan Mulder expressed his frustration at not being able to play due to injury but is determined to make a significant contribution upon his return to the South African cricket team.

After four weeks on the sidelines with a broken finger, Mulder is now fit to play in the upcoming Test against Pakistan. He has shown significant improvement in his batting and bowling performances and is eager to prove himself.

item.title: ‘Rohit Sharma has earned right to walk away from Test cricket ‘on his own terms’: Michael Clarke - The Indian Express
item.description:
Michael Clarke Supports Rohit Sharma's Right to Decide on Test Cricket Future

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Former Australia captain Michael Clarke has come to the defense of Indian captain Rohit Sharma, affirming that he has the right to step away from Test cricket on his own terms amidst performance pressure.

  • Rohit Sharma is experiencing criticism for his poor performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • He has scored an average of only 6.50 in the series with a highest score of 40.
  • Clarke believes Rohit's captaincy gives him leeway to make his own decisions regarding his career.
  • Former captain Aaron Finch remarked on the unsettled lineup of the Indian team since Rohit's return.
“I certainly think he’ll play at Sydney. I don’t think they’ll drop him. I think Rohit has earned the right and he’s captain.” - Michael Clarke

In conclusion, the cricket community continues to rally behind Rohit Sharma as he navigates through a challenging phase in his career, with significant support from former players regarding his future decisions.

item.title: ‘Cause for investigation’: Chess world miffed at Magnus Carlsen, Ian Nepomniachtchi sharing blitz title - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Cause for investigation’: Chess world miffed at Magnus Carlsen, Ian Nepomniachtchi sharing blitz title

Date: October 2023
Source: Not specified

Magnus Carlsen and Ian Nepomniachtchi's decision to share the World Blitz Championship title has caused uproar in the chess community after a potentially controversial conversation was leaked, raising questions about ethics in the sport.

  • Carlsen initially won two games against Nepomniachtchi, who then leveled the score at 2-2.
  • The final match went into a tiebreak where both agreed to share the title after drawing multiple times.
  • Criticism emerged from prominent figures in chess, including Hans Niemann, who called for an investigation into the ethics of the players' conduct.
  • Concerns about possible match fixing arose from a conversation between Carlsen and Nepomniachtchi.
  • Grandmasters expressed disappointment over the lack of robust regulations from FIDE regarding final match situations.
“This is cause for an investigation by the FIDE Ethics committee. I can’t believe that two players who maliciously accused me... are openly breaking the rules.” - Hans Niemann

The incident has sparked discussions on the integrity of chess regulations and what constitutes fair play among elite players.

item.title: 'Rohit Sharma, You Shattered India's Confidence': Captain Comes Under Scathing Attack After MCG Humiliation - NDTV Sports
item.description:
'Rohit Sharma, You Shattered India's Confidence': Captain Comes Under Scathing Attack After MCG Humiliation

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team captain Rohit Sharma faced intense criticism following India's defeat to Australia in the fourth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, with former cricketer Basit Ali questioning Sharma's captaincy decisions.

  • Rohit Sharma's decision to open batting despite poor form was criticized, affecting the team's confidence.
  • Basit Ali highlighted the detrimental impact on KL Rahul after demoting him in favor of Sharma.
  • Criticism extended to Gautam Gambhir for his game management decisions.
  • Rohit and Virat Kohli were both dismissed cheaply, contributing to the team's struggles.
  • Ali suggested a captaincy change for the final Test, proposing Jasprit Bumrah take over leadership.
“One decision: 'I will open', that affected India. You (Rohit) completely shattered the confidence of the team,” said Basit Ali.

Ali's remarks underscore the dissatisfaction with Rohit Sharma's leadership and decision-making during a critical match, calling for immediate changes in captaincy and strategy.
